body_html:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37571017/tensorflow-stuck-into-endless-loop-using-tf-while-loop

This might be related. As map_fn is in fact using while_loop internally, fn must NOT have side-effects and scalar_summary is in this case a side-effect. Is that right? If the dimension along which I need to split is unknown at graph construction time, is there any work-around that would let me collect the summaries from within the callable?

body:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37571017/tensorflow-stuck-into-endless-loop-using-tf-while-loop

This might be related. As map_fn is in fact using while_loop internally, `fn` must NOT have side-effects and `scalar_summary` is in this case a side-effect. Is that right? If the dimension along which I need to split is unknown at graph construction time, is there any work-around that would let me collect the summaries from within the callable?
